title:
Well-posedness for the semilinear wave equations with nonlinear damping
  on manifolds with conical degeneration
authors: Gongwei Liu, Yi Peng, Peng Li
abstract:
This paper deals with a class of semilinear wave equation with nonlinear
damping term $|u_{t}|^{m-2}u_t $ and nonlinear source term $g(x)|u|^{p-2}u$ on
the manifolds with conical singularities. Firstly, we prove the local existence
and uniqueness of the solution by the semigroup method. Secondly, we establish
the global existence, the energy decay estimate and the blow-up in finite time
of the solution with subcritial ($E(0)<d$) and critial ($E(0)=d$) initial
energy level by constructing potential wells. We also show that the solution is
global provided the damping dominates the source (that is $m\geq p$). Moreover,
we prove the blow-up in finite time of the solution with arbitrary positive
initial energy and give some necessary and sufficient condition for existing
finite time blow-up solutions.
